stories.text:
Hello, Im wondering if there are any ways to have a passwordless authentication for this new service I'll be implementing. I think I saw something the other day based on blockchain but didn't see any implementation examples.

I was thinking of making unique URL's and sending them to users email address.

If end users can access basic information that an admin has created for them, but still needs to be some what private. I do not see a reason to create accounts for all users.

A simple access url might be enough?

I'm not collecting sensitive information.

Name, email Phone (optional) for sms notifications.

Advice is appreciated.

Happy new year hackers!

Excited to share that we've launched our PCB Editor (alpha release) and welcome early feedback so we can continue to refine / add new features. The best performance will come on laptops (perhaps you can help?) since our users primarily work there.

We're hiring for a few more key roles in our early team; our devs enjoy high visibility and autonomy, contribute heavily to designs, and have the creative freedom to innovate.

Graphics Engineer (Three.js, webGL, typescript) - report to our CTO and own our web graphics initiatives from front-end rendering, tile mapping, performance tooling, and architecture of a major new product coming in 2022.

Dev Tools Engineer (Typescript, React, CI, GCP) - lead our infrastructure tooling efforts, CI/CD strategy, devsec, monitoring and performance for our realtime platform across all products.

We're remote friendly, well funded ($12M seed), and work on a modern stack. If you think you could be a good fit for our team, contact us at talent@flux.ai - thanks for reading!
